void fsdict::PatternWeights::clear (  )  [virtual]

Removes all the weights and defaults.

Does NOT change the setting of the smartMerge mode.

Referenced by fsdict::TestComputeInstruction::testBasics(), and fsdict::TestPattern::testPatternProbabilities().

void fsdict::PatternWeights::clearExplicitWeights (  )  [virtual]

Removes all the explicit weights, but leaves the defaults intact.

Does NOT change the setting of the smartMerge mode.

Returns:
the weight for a given pattern, or PatternWeights::UNDEF if the pattern is not known

Referenced by fsdict::TestPatternWeights::testBasics(), fsdict::TestComputeInstruction::testBasics(), fsdict::TestPattern::testPatternProbabilities(), and fsdict::TestComputeInstruction::testProfilerSetting().

void fsdict::PatternWeights::setSmartMerge ( bool  t = true  ) 

If "smartMerge" is activated, it will override the default settings (set via setDefault()) and return the weight UNDEF for all merges and splits of the form "xy <-> x" and "xy <-> y".

It does NOT override the specific weights added via setWeight()

Referenced by fsdict::TestComputeInstruction::testBasics().
